author: James Tanner
method: In a pan, cook the rice in the stock for about ten minutes, or until tender. Drain off any excess liquid. Heat the oil and butter in a frying pan and gently fry the onion and chilli until softened, about 4-5 minutes. Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir in the chopped herbs. Pack the rice into a small bowl and invert onto a serving plate. Tap gently and lift the bowl off. Scatter the toasted almonds over the top and serve.
ingredients: 150g/5½oz jasmine rice,  400ml/14fl oz chicken or vegetable stock,  1 tbsp olive oil,  25g/1oz butter,  ½ onion, finely chopped,  ½ red chilli, chopped,  2 tbsp chopped fresh parsley,  2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander,  50g/2oz toasted flaked almonds, to serve
